page.title: 18Snow at Pendock
page.content: In the Winter of 1984/85 we had a big snow storm, it was dreadful. We stayed off School for two days. If we went to School we had to take our wellington boots. At play time we played snow balls and made snow men and we made igloos. When we had to stay at home I played He-man. When we went to School the roads were slippery and skiddy. One day during Assembly we saw a fox on the playing field. We stopped and watched the fox trot right around our big field. It went slowly, looking at us, the snow showing up its lovely red coat. Later on we followed the fox's tracks to try to find its den. The lane outside the school was so slippery that everyone had to drive very carefully. A farmer brought his tractor to clear the School drive for the teachers to get their cars in.
